title: Usability Fundamentals
description: A collection of activities to check understanding of interface purpose and key usability principles at the Achieved level.

activities.title: Interface Purpose
activities.prompt: A student uses the school's online portal to check their timetable and see their NCEA results. What is the main purpose of this interface?

options.text: To allow students to access and view their personal academic information.
To make the school's website look modern and professional.
To reduce the number of teachers in the school.
To provide a platform for downloading software updates.

activities.explanation: The correct answer directly describes what the user achieves with the interface, which is the core of defining its purpose.

activities.title: Match Usability Heuristics
activities.prompt: Match the usability heuristic to its description.

pairs.right: Keeping the user informed about what is happening (e.g., a progress bar).
Providing an 'undo' button or a clear 'exit' to let users easily fix mistakes.
Showing options in a menu instead of making the user remember commands.
Designing the system to make mistakes less likely, like disabling a button.

distractorsRight: Making the interface pretty with lots of colours and fonts.
Using technical jargon to sound more professional.

activities.title: Match Usability Concepts
activities.prompt: Match the usability concept to its meaning.

pairs.right: When similar elements look and act the same way within a single website or app.
Designing an interface so it can be used by people with disabilities.
Ensuring words like 'whānau' are displayed with correct macrons.
When an interface works in a way that feels familiar based on other apps.

distractorsRight: Showing a progress bar when a file is uploading.
Making sure the app is available in many different countries.

activities.title: Steps to Buy a Product Online
activities.prompt: Arrange these steps in the correct order for a typical online shopping experience.
items: Search for the product using the search bar.
Add the desired product to the shopping cart.
Confirm the order and receive a confirmation message.

activities.title: Steps to Book a School Meeting Room
activities.prompt: Arrange these steps in the correct order for booking a meeting room using the school's online system.
items: Navigate to the 'Room Booking' section of the portal.
Select the desired date and time for the meeting.
Choose an available room from the list.
Fill in the reason for the booking.
Submit the booking request and check for a confirmation notice.
